metadata.title: CVE-2019-5736 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
runc through 1.0-rc6, as used in Docker before 18.09.2 and other products,allows attackers to overwrite the host runc binary (and consequently obtainhost root access) by leveraging the ability to execute a command as rootwithin one of these types of containers: (1) a new container with anattacker-controlled image, or (2) an existing container, to which theattacker previously had write access, that can be attached with dockerexec. This occurs because of file-descriptor mishandling, related to/proc/self/exe.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5736` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

runc - 1.0.0~rc2+docker1.13.1-0ubuntu1~16.04.1
No subscription required

docker.io - 18.06.1-0ubuntu1.2~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: runc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0~rc2+docker1.13.1-0ubuntu1~16.04.1').
docker.io package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '18.06.1-0ubuntu1.2~16.04.1').
